Key Match Events: Bailey Peacock-Farrell superbly clawed out a header from midfielder Georgi Kostadinov at the near post.

Bulgaria took the lead two minutes later. Peacock-Farrell’s clearance towards Daniel Ballard fell short and Kolev nipped in to slip the ball to the back post where captain Despodov tucked it away from four yards.
Northern Ireland’s first chance came shortly after. Isaac Price found space just outside the area, however he shot straight at Bulgaria keeper Dimitar Mitov.
Another swift counter attack put Kolev clear inside the area. His weak shot was comfortably saved by Peacock-Farrell.
Post-Match Reflections: Northern Ireland, who enjoyed a comfortable 2-0 win over Luxembourg in their C3 opener on Thursday, have now slipped to third place in the group behind Bulgaria and Belarus.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In sultry conditions on a lumpy pitch at Stadion Hristo Botev in Plovdiv tonight they were left frustrated after Bulgaria scored in the 40th minute and defended strongly from then on to claim all three points in the UNL League C Group 3 clash.
